Target: OntoPlanningRegulations is an ontology developed to describe the regulations imposed for urban planning purposes.

Comment: Planning regulations are a set of rules and guidelines established by competent authorities at the local, regional, or national level to control and manage the development and use of land and properties within a specific geographic area.
Label: Planning Regulation

Comment: Area regulation are special planning regulations that take precedence over other regulations in specific geographic areas. They are usually enforced using geospatial boundaries, denoting that their rules and provisions apply exclusively to entities within the specified geospatial boundary. The intent behind area regulations is often to address unique or localised needs, challenges, or opportunities, and they can vary significantly from standard zoning or land use regulations.
Label: Area Regulation

Comment: A type of area regulation that is designated for the preservation and protection of its historical, architectural, cultural, or environmental heritage within specific areas or districts.
Label: Conservation Area

Comment: A type of area regulation that is designated to control the building heights of a specific area.
Label: Height Control Plan

Comment: A type of area regulation to help retain the character of landed housing estates. This plan identify the locations of these safeguarded estates and the type and storey height of housing that can be built in the estate.
Label: Landed Housing Area

Comment: A type of conservation area regulations intended only for good class bungalow.
Label: Good Class Bungalow Area

Comment: A type of area regulation that guide the detailed setback, storey height and building height.
Label: Street Block Plan

Comment: Type regulation is a form of specialised planning regulations that provide guidelines to any urban entities based on their type. For instance, a Commercial development control plan will apply to zones with commercial zone type. These regulations are designed to address specific land use or development needs associated with their zone uses. Note that these regulations might only provide a range of guidelines for specific restrictions, but individual plots may differ from these guidelines. For instance, Commercial Zone Type might have a maximum floor-to-floor height of 5m in the type regulation, but specific plots might have a lower maximum number.
Label: Type Regulation

Comment: Each road may have a road category, that may affect the required road buffer, allowed number of storeys, and allowed programmes.
Label: Road Category

Comment: These regulations apply to roads in Road Category 1. These are expressways that form the primary network where all long distance traffic movements should be directed. It is planned to optimise long distance mobility from one part of the island to another.
Label: Road Category 1

Comment: These regulations apply to roads in Road Category 2. These are major arterial roads, which predominantly carries traffic through from one region to another, forming principle avenues of communication for urban traffic movements. It interconnects expressways and minor arterial as well as with other major arterial roads.
Label: Road Category 2

Comment: These regulations apply to roads in Road Category 3. These are minor arterial roads that distribute traffic within the major residential and industrial areas. It is planned to optimise circulation within the area and facilitate through traffic between adjacent towns.
Label: Road Category 3

Comment: These regulations apply to roads in Road Category 4. These are primary access roads that form the link between local access and arterial roads. It provides access to developments and through traffic is discouraged. However, where a development is also accessible by a local access road, the access shall be located at the local access road.
Label: Road Category 4

Comment: These regulations apply to roads in Road Category 5. These are local access roads that give direct access to buildings and other developments and should connect only with primary access roads.
Label: Road Category 5

Comment: A competent authority is any public officer or statutory body established by written law with legislative power to make decisions and enforce regulations within their jurisdication.
Label: Competent Authority

Comment: Absolute Height defines the total vertical measurement of the building from its lowest underground storey to the highest roof. It should account for all storeys and their heights in this calculation
Label: Absolute Height

Comment: Building Height defines the vertical measurement of the building from its ground floor to the highest point on the roof or an architectural element. This measure ignores the elevation of the ground floor from the sea level and is only concerned with the building height.
Label: Building Height

Comment: Building Mass Ratio is the ratio of the maximum allowable building volume in relation to the land area.
Label: Building Mass Ratio

Comment: Floor To Floor Height defines the height from the floor of the current storey to the floor of the next storey.
Label: Floor To Floor Height

Comment: Gross Floor Area is the total floor area of an urban entity such as a land plot or building, typically measured in square feet or square meters. This measurement only considers the floor or footprint of each storey and their area, and does not include their walls or ceiling.
Label: Gross Floor Area

Comment: Gross Plot Ratio is the ratio of maximum allowable Gross Floor Area to the Land Area.
Label: Gross Plot Ratio

Comment: Setback defines the distance from the plot boundary that any development can occur.
Label: Setback

Comment: Front Setback applies to the side of the plot that has the main entrance facing the road.
Label: Front Setback

Comment: Rear Setback applies to the side of the plot that is opposite of its front side.
Label: Rear Setback

Comment: Road Buffer refers to setbacks related to the road category of the adjacent plot. A plot may have more than one road buffer if it is adjacent to multiple road plots.
Label: Road Buffer

Comment: Side Setback apply to the side of the plot that is not Front nor Rear.
Label: Side Setback

Comment: PartyWall setback refers to Side setback whose buffer distance is required to be 0m.
Label: Party Wall

Comment: Site Coverage defines the ratio of a land plot that can be occupied or covered by a building or structure.
Label: Site Coverage

Comment: A relationship defining the allowable absolute height that a given planning regulation has provided.
Label: allows absolute height

Comment: A relationship defining the allowable building height that a given planning regulation has provided.
Label: allows building height

Comment: A relationship defining the allowable building mass ratio that a given planning regulation has provided.
Label: allows building mass ratio

Comment: A relationship defining the allowable gross floor area that a given planning regulation has provided.
Label: allows gross floor area

Comment: A relationship defining the allowable gross plot ratio that a given planning regulation has provided.
Label: allows gross plot ratio

Comment: A relationship defining the allowable site coverage that a given planning regulation has provided.
Label: allows site coverage

Comment: A relationship defining the road category regulations for a specific planning regulation.
Label: is constrained by

Comment: A relationship that connects the planning regulation to their urban entity. Generally, all plots have general planning regulations, while area regulations applies to specific zones and type regulations applies to specific zone types.
Label: applies to

Comment: A relationship that connects the planning regulation to their urban entity. Generally, all plots have general planning regulations, while area regulations applies to specific zones and type regulations applies to specific zone types.
Label: applies to

Comment: A relationship that connects the planning regulation to their urban entity. Generally, all plots have general planning regulations, while area regulations applies to specific zones and type regulations applies to specific zone types.
Label: applies to

Comment: A relationship defining the required floor to floor height of an urban entity which is enforced by a planning regulation.
Label: requires floor to floor height

Comment: A relationship defining the required party wall for an urban entity which is enforced by a planning regulation.
Label: requires party wall

Comment: A relationship defining the required road buffer for an urban entity which is enforced by a planning regulation.
Label: requires road buffer

Comment: A relationship defining the required setback of an urban entity which is enforced by a planning regulation.
Label: requires setback

Comment: A relationship that indicates which competent authority has establish the specified planning regulation.
Label: is legislated by

Comment: A boolean indicator indicating if the regulation applies only to corner plots.
Label: for corner plot

Comment: A boolean indicator indicating if the regulation applies only to fringe plots.
Label: for fringe plot
